t: Luke 17
Sin, Faith, Duty
Jesus*p said to his disciples: “Things*r that*r cause*r people*r to*r stumble*r are*r bound*r to*r come,*r but*r woe*r to*r anyone*r through*r whom*r they*r come.*r

It*r would*r be*r better*r for*r them*r to*r be*r thrown*r into*r the*r sea*r with*r a*r millstone*r tied*r around*r their*r neck*r than*r to*r cause*r one*r of*r these*r little*r ones*r to*r stumble.*r
So*r watch*r yourselves.*r “If*rp your*r brother*r or*r sister*r sins*r against*r you,*r rebuke*r them;*r and*r if*r they*r repent,*r forgive*r them.*r
Even*r if*r they*r sin*r against*r you*r seven*r times*r in*r a*r day*r and*r seven*r times*r come*r back*r to*r you*r saying*r ‘I*r repent,’*r you*r must*r forgive*r them.”*r
The*p apostles said to the Lord, “Increase our faith!”

He*p replied, “If*r you*r have*r faith*r as*r small*r as*r a*r mustard*r seed,*r you*r can*r say*r to*r this*r mulberry*r tree,*r ‘Be*r uprooted*r and*r planted*r in*r the*r sea,’*r and*r it*r will*r obey*r you.*r

“Suppose*rp one*r of*r you*r has*r a*r servant*r plowing*r or*r looking*r after*r the*r sheep.*r Will*r he*r say*r to*r the*r servant*r when*r he*r comes*r in*r from*r the*r field,*r ‘Come*r along*r now*r and*r sit*r down*r to*r eat’?*r
Won’t*r he*r rather*r say,*r ‘Prepare*r my*r supper,*r get*r yourself*r ready*r and*r wait*r on*r me*r while*r I*r eat*r and*r drink;*r after*r that*r you*r may*r eat*r and*r drink’?*r
Will*r he*r thank*r the*r servant*r because*r he*r did*r what*r he*r was*r told*r to*r do?*r
So*r you*r also,*r when*r you*r have*r done*r everything*r you*r were*r told*r to*r do,*r should*r say,*r ‘We*r are*r unworthy*r servants;*r we*r have*r only*r done*r our*r duty.’ ”*r
Jesus Heals Ten Men With Leprosy
Now*p on his way to Jerusalem, Jesus traveled along the border between Samaria and Galilee.
As he was going into a village, ten men who had leprosy met him. They stood at a distance
and called out in a loud voice, “Jesus, Master, have pity on us!”
When*p he saw them, he said, “Go,*r show*r yourselves*r to*r the*r priests.”*r And as they went, they were cleansed.
One*p of them, when he saw he was healed, came back, praising God in a loud voice.
He threw himself at Jesus’ feet and thanked him—and he was a Samaritan.
Jesus*p asked, “Were*r not*r all*r ten*r cleansed?*r Where*r are*r the*r other*r nine?*r
Has*r no*r one*r returned*r to*r give*r praise*r to*r God*r except*r this*r foreigner?”*r
Then he said to him, “Rise*r and*r go;*r your*r faith*r has*r made*r you*r well.”*r
The Coming of the Kingdom of God
Once,*p on being asked by the Pharisees when the kingdom of God would come, Jesus replied, “The*r coming*r of*r the*r kingdom*r of*r God*r is*r not*r something*r that*r can*r be*r observed,*r
nor*r will*r people*r say,*r ‘Here*r it*r is,’*r or*r ‘There*r it*r is,’*r because*r the*r kingdom*r of*r God*r is*r in*r your*r midst.”*r
Then*p he said to his disciples, “The*r time*r is*r coming*r when*r you*r will*r long*r to*r see*r one*r of*r the*r days*r of*r the*r Son*r of*r Man,*r but*r you*r will*r not*r see*r it.*r
People*r will*r tell*r you,*r ‘There*r he*r is!’*r or*r ‘Here*r he*r is!’*r Do*r not*r go*r running*r off*r after*r them.*r
For*r the*r Son*r of*r Man*r in*r his*r day*r will*r be*r like*r the*r lightning,*r which*r flashes*r and*r lights*r up*r the*r sky*r from*r one*r end*r to*r the*r other.*r
But*r first*r he*r must*r suffer*r many*r things*r and*r be*r rejected*r by*r this*r generation.*r
“Just*rp as*r it*r was*r in*r the*r days*r of*r Noah,*r so*r also*r will*r it*r be*r in*r the*r days*r of*r the*r Son*r of*r Man.*r
People*r were*r eating,*r drinking,*r marrying*r and*r being*r given*r in*r marriage*r up*r to*r the*r day*r Noah*r entered*r the*r ark.*r Then*r the*r flood*r came*r and*r destroyed*r them*r all.*r
“It*rp was*r the*r same*r in*r the*r days*r of*r Lot.*r People*r were*r eating*r and*r drinking,*r buying*r and*r selling,*r planting*r and*r building.*r
But*r the*r day*r Lot*r left*r Sodom,*r fire*r and*r sulfur*r rained*r down*r from*r heaven*r and*r destroyed*r them*r all.*r
“It*rp will*r be*r just*r like*r this*r on*r the*r day*r the*r Son*r of*r Man*r is*r revealed.*r

On*r that*r day*r no*r one*r who*r is*r on*r the*r housetop,*r with*r possessions*r inside,*r should*r go*r down*r to*r get*r them.*r Likewise,*r no*r one*r in*r the*r field*r should*r go*r back*r for*r anything.*r
Remember*r Lot’s*r wife!*r
Whoever*r tries*r to*r keep*r their*r life*r will*r lose*r it,*r and*r whoever*r loses*r their*r life*r will*r preserve*r it.*r
I*r tell*r you,*r on*r that*r night*r two*r people*r will*r be*r in*r one*r bed;*r one*r will*r be*r taken*r and*r the*r other*r left.*r
Two*r women*r will*r be*r grinding*r grain*r together;*r one*r will*r be*r taken*r and*r the*r other*r left.”*r
“Where,*p Lord?” they asked. He*p replied, “Where*r there*r is*r a*r dead*r body,*r there*r the*r vultures*r will*r gather.”*r
